info.name: Input and Output
info.description:
The Dolby.io Media Input and Media Output APIs for reading and writing dlb:// URLs.

[https://docs.dolby.io/media-apis/reference/introduction-to-media-io](https://docs.dolby.io/media-apis/reference/introduction-to-media-io)

query.description: The url should be in the form dlb://object-key where the object-key can be any alpha-numeric string. The object-key is unique to your account API Key so there is no risk of collision with other users.

request.description:
You can download media you previously uploaded with /media/input  
or media that was generated through another Dolby Media API.

The temporary storage should allow you to read and write to the dlb://  
locations for a period of at least 24 hours before it is removed.

To use the Dolby provided temporary storage is a two step process.

You start by declaring a `dlb://` url that you can reference in any other Media API calls. The response will provide a url where you can put your media. This allows you to use the `dlb://` url as a short-cut for a temporary storage location.

You'll be returned a pre-signed url you can use to `PUT` and upload your media file. The temporary storage should allow you to read and write to the dlb:// locations for a period of at least 24 hours before it is removed.
